24/* You have to define the following before including this file:
25
26 UWtype -- An unsigned type, default type for operations (typically a "word")
27 UHWtype -- An unsigned type, at least half the size of UWtype
28 UDWtype -- An unsigned type, at least twice as large a UWtype
29 W_TYPE_SIZE -- size in bits of UWtype
30
31 SItype, USItype -- Signed and unsigned 32 bit types
32 DItype, UDItype -- Signed and unsigned 64 bit types
33
34 On a 32 bit machine UWtype should typically be USItype;
35 on a 64 bit machine, UWtype should typically be UDItype.
36
37 Optionally, define:
38
39 LONGLONG_STANDALONE -- Avoid code that needs machine-dependent support files
40 NO_ASM -- Disable inline asm
41
42
43 CAUTION! Using this version of longlong.h outside of GMP is not safe. You
44 need to include gmp.h and gmp-impl.h, or certain things might not work as
45 expected.
46*/
47
48#define __BITS4 (W_TYPE_SIZE / 4)
49#define __ll_B ((UWtype) 1 << (W_TYPE_SIZE / 2))
50#define __ll_lowpart(t) ((UWtype) (t) & (__ll_B - 1))
51#define __ll_highpart(t) ((UWtype) (t) >> (W_TYPE_SIZE / 2))
52
53/* This is used to make sure no undesirable sharing between different libraries
54 that use this file takes place. */
55#ifndef __MPN
56#define __MPN(x) __##x
57#endif
58
59/* Define auxiliary asm macros.
60
61 1) umul_ppmm(high_prod, low_prod, multiplier, multiplicand) multiplies two
62 UWtype integers MULTIPLIER and MULTIPLICAND, and generates a two UWtype
63 word product in HIGH_PROD and LOW_PROD.
64
65 2) __umulsidi3(a,b) multiplies two UWtype integers A and B, and returns a
66 UDWtype product. This is just a variant of umul_ppmm.
67
68 3) udiv_qrnnd(quotient, remainder, high_numerator, low_numerator,
69 denominator) divides a UDWtype, composed by the UWtype integers
70 HIGH_NUMERATOR and LOW_NUMERATOR, by DENOMINATOR and places the quotient
71 in QUOTIENT and the remainder in REMAINDER. HIGH_NUMERATOR must be less
72 than DENOMINATOR for correct operation. If, in addition, the most
73 significant bit of DENOMINATOR must be 1, then the pre-processor symbol
74 UDIV_NEEDS_NORMALIZATION is defined to 1.
75
76 4) sdiv_qrnnd(quotient, remainder, high_numerator, low_numerator,
77 denominator). Like udiv_qrnnd but the numbers are signed. The quotient
78 is rounded towards 0.
79
80 5) count_leading_zeros(count, x) counts the number of zero-bits from the
81 msb to the first non-zero bit in the UWtype X. This is the number of
82 steps X needs to be shifted left to set the msb. Undefined for X == 0,
83 unless the symbol COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 is defined to some value.
84
85 6) count_trailing_zeros(count, x) like count_leading_zeros, but counts
86 from the least significant end.
87
88 7) add_ssaaaa(high_sum, low_sum, high_addend_1, low_addend_1,
89 high_addend_2, low_addend_2) adds two UWtype integers, composed by
90 HIGH_ADDEND_1 and LOW_ADDEND_1, and HIGH_ADDEND_2 and LOW_ADDEND_2
91 respectively. The result is placed in HIGH_SUM and LOW_SUM. Overflow
92 (i.e. carry out) is not stored anywhere, and is lost.
93
94 8) sub_ddmmss(high_difference, low_difference, high_minuend, low_minuend,
95 high_subtrahend, low_subtrahend) subtracts two two-word UWtype integers,
96 composed by HIGH_MINUEND_1 and LOW_MINUEND_1, and HIGH_SUBTRAHEND_2 and
97 LOW_SUBTRAHEND_2 respectively. The result is placed in HIGH_DIFFERENCE
98 and LOW_DIFFERENCE. Overflow (i.e. carry out) is not stored anywhere,
99 and is lost.
100
101 If any of these macros are left undefined for a particular CPU,
102 C macros are used.
103
104
105 Notes:
106
107 For add_ssaaaa the two high and two low addends can both commute, but
108 unfortunately gcc only supports one "%" commutative in each asm block.
109 This has always been so but is only documented in recent versions
110 (eg. pre-release 3.3). Having two or more "%"s can cause an internal
111 compiler error in certain rare circumstances.
112
113 Apparently it was only the last "%" that was ever actually respected, so
114 the code has been updated to leave just that. Clearly there's a free
115 choice whether high or low should get it, if there's a reason to favour
116 one over the other. Also obviously when the constraints on the two
117 operands are identical there's no benefit to the reloader in any "%" at
118 all.
119
120 */
121
122/* The CPUs come in alphabetical order below.
123
124 Please add support for more CPUs here, or improve the current support
125 for the CPUs below! */
126
127
128/* count_leading_zeros_gcc_clz is count_leading_zeros implemented with gcc
129 3.4 __builtin_clzl or __builtin_clzll, according to our limb size.
130 Similarly count_trailing_zeros_gcc_ctz using __builtin_ctzl or
131 __builtin_ctzll.
132
133 These builtins are only used when we check what code comes out, on some
134 chips they're merely libgcc calls, where we will instead want an inline
135 in that case (either asm or generic C).
136
137 These builtins are better than an asm block of the same insn, since an
138 asm block doesn't give gcc any information about scheduling or resource
139 usage. We keep an asm block for use on prior versions of gcc though.
140
141 For reference, __builtin_ffs existed in gcc prior to __builtin_clz, but
142 it's not used (for count_leading_zeros) because it generally gives extra
143 code to ensure the result is 0 when the input is 0, which we don't need
144 or want. */
145
146#ifdef _LONG_LONG_LIMB
147#define count_leading_zeros_gcc_clz(count,x) \
148 do { \
149 ASSERT ((x) != 0); \
150 (count) = __builtin_clzll (x); \
151 } while (0)
152#else
153#define count_leading_zeros_gcc_clz(count,x) \
154 do { \
155 ASSERT ((x) != 0); \
156 (count) = __builtin_clzl (x); \
157 } while (0)
158#endif
159
160#ifdef _LONG_LONG_LIMB
161#define count_trailing_zeros_gcc_ctz(count,x) \
162 do { \
163 ASSERT ((x) != 0); \
164 (count) = __builtin_ctzll (x); \
165 } while (0)
166#else
167#define count_trailing_zeros_gcc_ctz(count,x) \
168 do { \
169 ASSERT ((x) != 0); \
170 (count) = __builtin_ctzl (x); \
171 } while (0)
172#endif
173
174
175/* FIXME: The macros using external routines like __MPN(count_leading_zeros)
176 don't need to be under !NO_ASM */
177#if ! defined (NO_ASM)
178
179#if defined (__alpha) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 64
180/* Most alpha-based machines, except Cray systems. */
181#if defined (__GNUC__)
182#if __GMP_GNUC_PREREQ (3,3)
183#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
184 do { \
185 UDItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
186 (ph) = __builtin_alpha_umulh (__m0, __m1); \
187 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
188 } while (0)
189#else
190#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
191 do { \
192 UDItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
193 __asm__ ("umulh %r1,%2,%0" \
194 : "=r" (ph) \
195 : "%rJ" (__m0), "rI" (__m1)); \
196 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
197 } while (0)
198#endif
199#define UMUL_TIME 18
200#else /* ! __GNUC__ */
201#include <machine/builtins.h>
202#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
203 do { \
204 UDItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
205 (ph) = __UMULH (__m0, __m1); \
206 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
207 } while (0)
208#endif
209#ifndef LONGLONG_STANDALONE
210#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
211 do { UWtype __di; \
212 __di = __MPN(invert_limb) (d); \
213 udiv_qrnnd_preinv (q, r, n1, n0, d, __di); \
214 } while (0)
215#define UDIV_PREINV_ALWAYS 1
216#define UDIV_NEEDS_NORMALIZATION 1
217#define UDIV_TIME 220
218#endif /* LONGLONG_STANDALONE */
219
220/* clz_tab is required in all configurations, since mpn/alpha/cntlz.asm
221 always goes into libgmp.so, even when not actually used. */
222#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_NEED_CLZ_TAB
223
224#if defined (__GNUC__) && HAVE_HOST_CPU_alpha_CIX
225#define count_leading_zeros(COUNT,X) \
226 __asm__("ctlz %1,%0" : "=r"(COUNT) : "r"(X))
227#define count_trailing_zeros(COUNT,X) \
228 __asm__("cttz %1,%0" : "=r"(COUNT) : "r"(X))
229#endif /* clz/ctz using cix */
230
231#if ! defined (count_leading_zeros) \
232 && defined (__GNUC__) && ! defined (LONGLONG_STANDALONE)
233/* ALPHA_CMPBGE_0 gives "cmpbge $31,src,dst", ie. test src bytes == 0.
234 "$31" is written explicitly in the asm, since an "r" constraint won't
235 select reg 31. There seems no need to worry about "r31" syntax for cray,
236 since gcc itself (pre-release 3.4) emits just $31 in various places. */
237#define ALPHA_CMPBGE_0(dst, src) \
238 do { asm ("cmpbge $31, %1, %0" : "=r" (dst) : "r" (src)); } while (0)
239/* Zero bytes are turned into bits with cmpbge, a __clz_tab lookup counts
240 them, locating the highest non-zero byte. A second __clz_tab lookup
241 counts the leading zero bits in that byte, giving the result. */
242#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
243 do { \
244 UWtype __clz__b, __clz__c, __clz__x = (x); \
245 ALPHA_CMPBGE_0 (__clz__b, __clz__x); /* zero bytes */ \
246 __clz__b = __clz_tab [(__clz__b >> 1) ^ 0x7F]; /* 8 to 1 byte */ \
247 __clz__b = __clz__b * 8 - 7; /* 57 to 1 shift */ \
248 __clz__x >>= __clz__b; \
249 __clz__c = __clz_tab [__clz__x]; /* 8 to 1 bit */ \
250 __clz__b = 65 - __clz__b; \
251 (count) = __clz__b - __clz__c; \
252 } while (0)
253#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_NEED_CLZ_TAB
254#endif /* clz using cmpbge */
255
256#if ! defined (count_leading_zeros) && ! defined (LONGLONG_STANDALONE)
257#if HAVE_ATTRIBUTE_CONST
258long __MPN(count_leading_zeros) (UDItype) __attribute__ ((const));
259#else
260long __MPN(count_leading_zeros) (UDItype);
261#endif
262#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
263 ((count) = __MPN(count_leading_zeros) (x))
264#endif /* clz using mpn */
265#endif /* __alpha */
266
267#if defined (__AVR) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 8
268#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
269 do { \
270 unsigned short __p = (unsigned short) (m0) * (m1); \
271 (ph) = __p >> 8; \
272 (pl) = __p; \
273 } while (0)
274#endif /* AVR */
275
276#if defined (_CRAY) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 64
277#include <intrinsics.h>
278#define UDIV_PREINV_ALWAYS 1
279#define UDIV_NEEDS_NORMALIZATION 1
280#define UDIV_TIME 220
281long __MPN(count_leading_zeros) (UDItype);
282#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
283 ((count) = _leadz ((UWtype) (x)))
284#if defined (_CRAYIEEE) /* I.e., Cray T90/ieee, T3D, and T3E */
285#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
286 do { \
287 UDItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
288 (ph) = _int_mult_upper (__m0, __m1); \
289 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
290 } while (0)
291#ifndef LONGLONG_STANDALONE
292#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
293 do { UWtype __di; \
294 __di = __MPN(invert_limb) (d); \
295 udiv_qrnnd_preinv (q, r, n1, n0, d, __di); \
296 } while (0)
297#endif /* LONGLONG_STANDALONE */
298#endif /* _CRAYIEEE */
299#endif /* _CRAY */
300
301#if defined (__ia64) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 64
302/* This form encourages gcc (pre-release 3.4 at least) to emit predicated
303 "sub r=r,r" and "sub r=r,r,1", giving a 2 cycle latency. The generic
304 code using "al<bl" arithmetically comes out making an actual 0 or 1 in a
305 register, which takes an extra cycle. */
306#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
307 do { \
308 UWtype __x; \
309 __x = (al) - (bl); \
310 if ((al) < (bl)) \
311 (sh) = (ah) - (bh) - 1; \
312 else \
313 (sh) = (ah) - (bh); \
314 (sl) = __x; \
315 } while (0)
316#if defined (__GNUC__) && ! defined (__INTEL_COMPILER)
317/* Do both product parts in assembly, since that gives better code with
318 all gcc versions. Some callers will just use the upper part, and in
319 that situation we waste an instruction, but not any cycles. */
320#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
321 __asm__ ("xma.hu %0 = %2, %3, f0\n\txma.l %1 = %2, %3, f0" \
322 : "=&f" (ph), "=f" (pl) \
323 : "f" (m0), "f" (m1))
324#define UMUL_TIME 14
325#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
326 do { \
327 UWtype _x = (x), _y, _a, _c; \
328 __asm__ ("mux1 %0 = %1, @rev" : "=r" (_y) : "r" (_x)); \
329 __asm__ ("czx1.l %0 = %1" : "=r" (_a) : "r" (-_y | _y)); \
330 _c = (_a - 1) << 3; \
331 _x >>= _c; \
332 if (_x >= 1 << 4) \
333 _x >>= 4, _c += 4; \
334 if (_x >= 1 << 2) \
335 _x >>= 2, _c += 2; \
336 _c += _x >> 1; \
337 (count) = W_TYPE_SIZE - 1 - _c; \
338 } while (0)
339/* similar to what gcc does for __builtin_ffs, but 0 based rather than 1
340 based, and we don't need a special case for x==0 here */
341#define count_trailing_zeros(count, x) \
342 do { \
343 UWtype __ctz_x = (x); \
344 __asm__ ("popcnt %0 = %1" \
345 : "=r" (count) \
346 : "r" ((__ctz_x-1) & ~__ctz_x)); \
347 } while (0)
348#endif
349#if defined (__INTEL_COMPILER)
350#include <ia64intrin.h>
351#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
352 do { \
353 UWtype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
354 ph = _m64_xmahu (__m0, __m1, 0); \
355 pl = __m0 * __m1; \
356 } while (0)
357#endif
358#ifndef LONGLONG_STANDALONE
359#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
360 do { UWtype __di; \
361 __di = __MPN(invert_limb) (d); \
362 udiv_qrnnd_preinv (q, r, n1, n0, d, __di); \
363 } while (0)
364#define UDIV_PREINV_ALWAYS 1
365#define UDIV_NEEDS_NORMALIZATION 1
366#endif
367#define UDIV_TIME 220
368#endif
369
370
371#if defined (__GNUC__)
372
373/* We sometimes need to clobber "cc" with gcc2, but that would not be
374 understood by gcc1. Use cpp to avoid major code duplication. */
375#if __GNUC__ < 2
376#define __CLOBBER_CC
377#define __AND_CLOBBER_CC
378#else /* __GNUC__ >= 2 */
379#define __CLOBBER_CC : "cc"
380#define __AND_CLOBBER_CC , "cc"
381#endif /* __GNUC__ < 2 */
382
383#if (defined (__a29k__) || defined (_AM29K)) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
384#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
385 __asm__ ("add %1,%4,%5\n\taddc %0,%2,%3" \
386 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
387 : "r" (ah), "rI" (bh), "%r" (al), "rI" (bl))
388#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
389 __asm__ ("sub %1,%4,%5\n\tsubc %0,%2,%3" \
390 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
391 : "r" (ah), "rI" (bh), "r" (al), "rI" (bl))
392#define umul_ppmm(xh, xl, m0, m1) \
393 do { \
394 USItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
395 __asm__ ("multiplu %0,%1,%2" \
396 : "=r" (xl) \
397 : "r" (__m0), "r" (__m1)); \
398 __asm__ ("multmu %0,%1,%2" \
399 : "=r" (xh) \
400 : "r" (__m0), "r" (__m1)); \
401 } while (0)
402#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
403 __asm__ ("dividu %0,%3,%4" \
404 : "=r" (q), "=q" (r) \
405 : "1" (n1), "r" (n0), "r" (d))
406#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
407 __asm__ ("clz %0,%1" \
408 : "=r" (count) \
409 : "r" (x))
410#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 32
411#endif /* __a29k__ */
412
413#if defined (__arc__)
414#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
415 __asm__ ("add.f\t%1, %4, %5\n\tadc\t%0, %2, %3" \
416 : "=r" (sh), \
417 "=&r" (sl) \
418 : "r" ((USItype) (ah)), \
419 "rIJ" ((USItype) (bh)), \
420 "%r" ((USItype) (al)), \
421 "rIJ" ((USItype) (bl)))
422#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
423 __asm__ ("sub.f\t%1, %4, %5\n\tsbc\t%0, %2, %3" \
424 : "=r" (sh), \
425 "=&r" (sl) \
426 : "r" ((USItype) (ah)), \
427 "rIJ" ((USItype) (bh)), \
428 "r" ((USItype) (al)), \
429 "rIJ" ((USItype) (bl)))
430#endif
431
432#if defined (__arm__) && (defined (__thumb2__) || !defined (__thumb__)) \
433 && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
434#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
435 __asm__ ("adds\t%1, %4, %5\n\tadc\t%0, %2, %3" \
436 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
437 : "r" (ah), "rI" (bh), "%r" (al), "rI" (bl) __CLOBBER_CC)
438#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
439 do { \
440 if (__builtin_constant_p (al)) \
441 { \
442 if (__builtin_constant_p (ah)) \
443 __asm__ ("rsbs\t%1, %5, %4\n\trsc\t%0, %3, %2" \
444 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
445 : "rI" (ah), "r" (bh), "rI" (al), "r" (bl) __CLOBBER_CC); \
446 else \
447 __asm__ ("rsbs\t%1, %5, %4\n\tsbc\t%0, %2, %3" \
448 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
449 : "r" (ah), "rI" (bh), "rI" (al), "r" (bl) __CLOBBER_CC); \
450 } \
451 else if (__builtin_constant_p (ah)) \
452 { \
453 if (__builtin_constant_p (bl)) \
454 __asm__ ("subs\t%1, %4, %5\n\trsc\t%0, %3, %2" \
455 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
456 : "rI" (ah), "r" (bh), "r" (al), "rI" (bl) __CLOBBER_CC); \
457 else \
458 __asm__ ("rsbs\t%1, %5, %4\n\trsc\t%0, %3, %2" \
459 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
460 : "rI" (ah), "r" (bh), "rI" (al), "r" (bl) __CLOBBER_CC); \
461 } \
462 else if (__builtin_constant_p (bl)) \
463 { \
464 if (__builtin_constant_p (bh)) \
465 __asm__ ("subs\t%1, %4, %5\n\tsbc\t%0, %2, %3" \
466 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
467 : "r" (ah), "rI" (bh), "r" (al), "rI" (bl) __CLOBBER_CC); \
468 else \
469 __asm__ ("subs\t%1, %4, %5\n\trsc\t%0, %3, %2" \
470 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
471 : "rI" (ah), "r" (bh), "r" (al), "rI" (bl) __CLOBBER_CC); \
472 } \
473 else /* only bh might be a constant */ \
474 __asm__ ("subs\t%1, %4, %5\n\tsbc\t%0, %2, %3" \
475 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
476 : "r" (ah), "rI" (bh), "r" (al), "rI" (bl) __CLOBBER_CC);\
477 } while (0)
478#if defined (__ARM_ARCH_2__) || defined (__ARM_ARCH_2A__) \
479 || defined (__ARM_ARCH_3__)
480#define umul_ppmm(xh, xl, a, b) \
481 do { \
482 register USItype __t0, __t1, __t2; \
483 __asm__ ("%@ Inlined umul_ppmm\n" \
484 " mov %2, %5, lsr #16\n" \
485 " mov %0, %6, lsr #16\n" \
486 " bic %3, %5, %2, lsl #16\n" \
487 " bic %4, %6, %0, lsl #16\n" \
488 " mul %1, %3, %4\n" \
489 " mul %4, %2, %4\n" \
490 " mul %3, %0, %3\n" \
491 " mul %0, %2, %0\n" \
492 " adds %3, %4, %3\n" \
493 " addcs %0, %0, #65536\n" \
494 " adds %1, %1, %3, lsl #16\n" \
495 " adc %0, %0, %3, lsr #16" \
496 : "=&r" ((USItype) (xh)), "=r" ((USItype) (xl)), \
497 "=&r" (__t0), "=&r" (__t1), "=r" (__t2) \
498 : "r" ((USItype) (a)), "r" ((USItype) (b)) __CLOBBER_CC); \
499 } while (0)
500#define UMUL_TIME 20
501#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
502 do { UWtype __r; \
503 (q) = __MPN(udiv_qrnnd) (&__r, (n1), (n0), (d)); \
504 (r) = __r; \
505 } while (0)
506extern UWtype __MPN(udiv_qrnnd) (UWtype *, UWtype, UWtype, UWtype);
507#define UDIV_TIME 200
508#else /* ARMv4 or newer */
509#define umul_ppmm(xh, xl, a, b) \
510 __asm__ ("umull %0,%1,%2,%3" : "=&r" (xl), "=&r" (xh) : "r" (a), "r" (b))
511#define UMUL_TIME 5
512#define smul_ppmm(xh, xl, a, b) \
513 __asm__ ("smull %0,%1,%2,%3" : "=&r" (xl), "=&r" (xh) : "r" (a), "r" (b))
514#ifndef LONGLONG_STANDALONE
515#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
516 do { UWtype __di; \
517 __di = __MPN(invert_limb) (d); \
518 udiv_qrnnd_preinv (q, r, n1, n0, d, __di); \
519 } while (0)
520#define UDIV_PREINV_ALWAYS 1
521#define UDIV_NEEDS_NORMALIZATION 1
522#define UDIV_TIME 70
523#endif /* LONGLONG_STANDALONE */
524#endif /* defined(__ARM_ARCH_2__) ... */
525#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) count_leading_zeros_gcc_clz(count, x)
526#define count_trailing_zeros(count, x) count_trailing_zeros_gcc_ctz(count, x)
527#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 32
528#endif /* __arm__ */
529
530#if defined (__aarch64__) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 64
531/* FIXME: Extend the immediate range for the low word by using both
532 ADDS and SUBS, since they set carry in the same way. */
533#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
534 __asm__ ("adds\t%1, %x4, %5\n\tadc\t%0, %x2, %x3" \
535 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
536 : "rZ" ((UDItype)(ah)), "rZ" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
537 "%r" ((UDItype)(al)), "rI" ((UDItype)(bl)) __CLOBBER_CC)
538#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
539 __asm__ ("subs\t%1, %x4, %5\n\tsbc\t%0, %x2, %x3" \
540 : "=r,r" (sh), "=&r,&r" (sl) \
541 : "rZ,rZ" ((UDItype)(ah)), "rZ,rZ" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
542 "r,Z" ((UDItype)(al)), "rI,r" ((UDItype)(bl)) __CLOBBER_CC)
543#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
544 do { \
545 UDItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
546 __asm__ ("umulh\t%0, %1, %2" : "=r" (ph) : "r" (__m0), "r" (__m1)); \
547 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
548 } while (0)
549#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) count_leading_zeros_gcc_clz(count, x)
550#define count_trailing_zeros(count, x) count_trailing_zeros_gcc_ctz(count, x)
551#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 64
552#endif /* __aarch64__ */

643#define UMUL_TIME 8

647#define UDIV_TIME 80
648#endif
649#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
650 do { \
651 USItype __tmp; \
652 __asm__ ( \
653 "ldi 1,%0\n" \
654" extru,= %1,15,16,%%r0 ; Bits 31..16 zero?\n" \
655" extru,tr %1,15,16,%1 ; No. Shift down, skip add.\n" \
656" ldo 16(%0),%0 ; Yes. Perform add.\n" \
657" extru,= %1,23,8,%%r0 ; Bits 15..8 zero?\n" \
658" extru,tr %1,23,8,%1 ; No. Shift down, skip add.\n" \
659" ldo 8(%0),%0 ; Yes. Perform add.\n" \
660" extru,= %1,27,4,%%r0 ; Bits 7..4 zero?\n" \
661" extru,tr %1,27,4,%1 ; No. Shift down, skip add.\n" \
662" ldo 4(%0),%0 ; Yes. Perform add.\n" \
663" extru,= %1,29,2,%%r0 ; Bits 3..2 zero?\n" \
664" extru,tr %1,29,2,%1 ; No. Shift down, skip add.\n" \
665" ldo 2(%0),%0 ; Yes. Perform add.\n" \
666" extru %1,30,1,%1 ; Extract bit 1.\n" \
667" sub %0,%1,%0 ; Subtract it.\n" \
668 : "=r" (count), "=r" (__tmp) : "1" (x)); \
669 } while (0)
670#endif /* hppa */

672/* These macros are for ABI=2.0w. In ABI=2.0n they can't be used, since GCC
673 (3.2) puts longlong into two adjacent 32-bit registers. Presumably this
674 is just a case of no direct support for 2.0n but treating it like 1.0. */
675#if defined (__hppa) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 64 && ! defined (_LONG_LONG_LIMB)

680#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \

686#if (defined (__i370__) || defined (__s390__) || defined (__mvs__)) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
687#if defined (__zarch__) || defined (HAVE_HOST_CPU_s390_zarch)
688#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
689 do { \
690/* if (__builtin_constant_p (bl)) \

699#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
700 do { \
701/* if (__builtin_constant_p (bl)) \
702 __asm__ ("slfi\t%1,%o5\n\tslbr\t%0,%3" \

705 else \

708 : "0" (ah), "r" (bh), "1" (al), "r" (bl) __CLOBBER_CC); \
709 } while (0)
710#if __GMP_GNUC_PREREQ (4,5)
711#define umul_ppmm(xh, xl, m0, m1) \
712 do { \
713 union {UDItype __ll; \
714 struct {USItype __h, __l;} __i; \
715 } __x; \
716 __x.__ll = (UDItype) (m0) * (UDItype) (m1); \
717 (xh) = __x.__i.__h; (xl) = __x.__i.__l; \
718 } while (0)
719#else
720#if 0
721/* FIXME: this fails if gcc knows about the 64-bit registers. Use only
722 with a new enough processor pretending we have 32-bit registers. */

725 union {UDItype __ll; \

731 (xh) = __x.__i.__h; (xl) = __x.__i.__l; \

733#else
734#define umul_ppmm(xh, xl, m0, m1) \
735 do { \
736 /* When we have 64-bit regs and gcc is aware of that, we cannot simply use
737 DImode for the product, since that would be allocated to a single 64-bit
738 register, whereas mlr uses the low 32-bits of an even-odd register pair.
739 */ \
740 register USItype __r0 __asm__ ("0"); \
741 register USItype __r1 __asm__ ("1") = (m0); \
742 __asm__ ("mlr\t%0,%3" \
743 : "=r" (__r0), "=r" (__r1) \
744 : "r" (__r1), "r" (m1)); \
745 (xh) = __r0; (xl) = __r1; \
746 } while (0)
747#endif /* if 0 */
748#endif

757 __x.__i.__h = n1; __x.__i.__l = n0; \
758 __asm__ ("dlr\t%0,%2" \
759 : "=r" (__x.__ll) \

761 (q) = __x.__i.__l; (r) = __x.__i.__h; \
762 } while (0)
763#else
764#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \

768 __asm__ ("dlr\t%0,%4" \
769 : "=r" (__r0), "=r" (__r1) \
770 : "r" (__r0), "r" (__r1), "r" (d)); \
771 (q) = __r1; (r) = __r0; \
772 } while (0)
773#endif /* if 0 */

801#if defined (__s390x__) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 64
802/* We need to cast operands with register constraints, otherwise their types
803 will be assumed to be SImode by gcc. For these machines, such operations
804 will insert a value into the low 32 bits, and leave the high 32 bits with
805 garbage. */
806#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
807 do { \
808 __asm__ ("algr\t%1,%5\n\talcgr\t%0,%3" \
809 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
810 : "0" ((UDItype)(ah)), "r" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
811 "%1" ((UDItype)(al)), "r" ((UDItype)(bl)) __CLOBBER_CC); \
812 } while (0)
813#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
814 do { \
815 __asm__ ("slgr\t%1,%5\n\tslbgr\t%0,%3" \
816 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
817 : "0" ((UDItype)(ah)), "r" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
818 "1" ((UDItype)(al)), "r" ((UDItype)(bl)) __CLOBBER_CC); \
819 } while (0)
820#define umul_ppmm(xh, xl, m0, m1) \
821 do { \
822 union {unsigned int __attribute__ ((mode(TI))) __ll; \
823 struct {UDItype __h, __l;} __i; \
824 } __x; \
825 __asm__ ("mlgr\t%0,%2" \
826 : "=r" (__x.__ll) \
827 : "%0" ((UDItype)(m0)), "r" ((UDItype)(m1))); \
828 (xh) = __x.__i.__h; (xl) = __x.__i.__l; \
829 } while (0)
830#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
831 do { \
832 union {unsigned int __attribute__ ((mode(TI))) __ll; \
833 struct {UDItype __h, __l;} __i; \
834 } __x; \
835 __x.__i.__h = n1; __x.__i.__l = n0; \
836 __asm__ ("dlgr\t%0,%2" \
837 : "=r" (__x.__ll) \
838 : "0" (__x.__ll), "r" ((UDItype)(d))); \
839 (q) = __x.__i.__l; (r) = __x.__i.__h; \
840 } while (0)
841#if 0 /* FIXME: Enable for z10 (?) */
842#define count_leading_zeros(cnt, x) \
843 do { \
844 union {unsigned int __attribute__ ((mode(TI))) __ll; \
845 struct {UDItype __h, __l;} __i; \
846 } __clr_cnt; \
847 __asm__ ("flogr\t%0,%1" \
848 : "=r" (__clr_cnt.__ll) \
849 : "r" (x) __CLOBBER_CC); \
850 (cnt) = __clr_cnt.__i.__h; \
851 } while (0)
852#endif
853#endif

855/* On x86 and x86_64, every asm implicitly clobbers "flags" and "fpsr",
856 so we don't need __CLOBBER_CC. */
857#if (defined (__i386__) || defined (__i486__)) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
858#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
859 __asm__ ("addl %5,%k1\n\tadcl %3,%k0" \
860 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
861 : "0" ((USItype)(ah)), "g" ((USItype)(bh)), \
862 "%1" ((USItype)(al)), "g" ((USItype)(bl)))
863#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
864 __asm__ ("subl %5,%k1\n\tsbbl %3,%k0" \
865 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
866 : "0" ((USItype)(ah)), "g" ((USItype)(bh)), \
867 "1" ((USItype)(al)), "g" ((USItype)(bl)))
868#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
869 __asm__ ("mull %3" \
870 : "=a" (w0), "=d" (w1) \
871 : "%0" ((USItype)(u)), "rm" ((USItype)(v)))
872#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, dx) /* d renamed to dx avoiding "=d" */\
873 __asm__ ("divl %4" /* stringification in K&R C */ \
874 : "=a" (q), "=d" (r) \
875 : "0" ((USItype)(n0)), "1" ((USItype)(n1)), "rm" ((USItype)(dx)))
876
877#if HAVE_HOST_CPU_i586 || HAVE_HOST_CPU_pentium || HAVE_HOST_CPU_pentiummmx
878/* Pentium bsrl takes between 10 and 72 cycles depending where the most
879 significant 1 bit is, hence the use of the following alternatives. bsfl
880 is slow too, between 18 and 42 depending where the least significant 1
881 bit is, so let the generic count_trailing_zeros below make use of the
882 count_leading_zeros here too. */
883
884#if HAVE_HOST_CPU_pentiummmx && ! defined (LONGLONG_STANDALONE)
885/* The following should be a fixed 14 or 15 cycles, but possibly plus an L1
886 cache miss reading from __clz_tab. For P55 it's favoured over the float
887 below so as to avoid mixing MMX and x87, since the penalty for switching
888 between the two is about 100 cycles.
889
890 The asm block sets __shift to -3 if the high 24 bits are clear, -2 for
891 16, -1 for 8, or 0 otherwise. This could be written equivalently as
892 follows, but as of gcc 2.95.2 it results in conditional jumps.
893
894 __shift = -(__n < 0x1000000);
895 __shift -= (__n < 0x10000);
896 __shift -= (__n < 0x100);
897
898 The middle two sbbl and cmpl's pair, and with luck something gcc
899 generates might pair with the first cmpl and the last sbbl. The "32+1"
900 constant could be folded into __clz_tab[], but it doesn't seem worth
901 making a different table just for that. */
902
903#define count_leading_zeros(c,n) \
904 do { \
905 USItype __n = (n); \
906 USItype __shift; \
907 __asm__ ("cmpl $0x1000000, %1\n" \
908 "sbbl %0, %0\n" \
909 "cmpl $0x10000, %1\n" \
910 "sbbl $0, %0\n" \
911 "cmpl $0x100, %1\n" \
912 "sbbl $0, %0\n" \
913 : "=&r" (__shift) : "r" (__n)); \
914 __shift = __shift*8 + 24 + 1; \
915 (c) = 32 + 1 - __shift - __clz_tab[__n >> __shift]; \
916 } while (0)
917#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_NEED_CLZ_TAB
918#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 31 /* n==0 indistinguishable from n==1 */
919
920#else /* ! pentiummmx || LONGLONG_STANDALONE */
921/* The following should be a fixed 14 cycles or so. Some scheduling
922 opportunities should be available between the float load/store too. This
923 sort of code is used in gcc 3 for __builtin_ffs (with "n&-n") and is
924 apparently suggested by the Intel optimizing manual (don't know exactly
925 where). gcc 2.95 or up will be best for this, so the "double" is
926 correctly aligned on the stack. */
927#define count_leading_zeros(c,n) \
928 do { \
929 union { \
930 double d; \
931 unsigned a[2]; \
932 } __u; \
933 ASSERT ((n) != 0); \
934 __u.d = (UWtype) (n); \
935 (c) = 0x3FF + 31 - (__u.a[1] >> 20); \
936 } while (0)
937#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 (0x3FF + 31)
938#endif /* pentiummx */
939
940#else /* ! pentium */
941
942#if __GMP_GNUC_PREREQ (3,4) /* using bsrl */
943#define count_leading_zeros(count,x) count_leading_zeros_gcc_clz(count,x)
944#endif /* gcc clz */
945
946/* On P6, gcc prior to 3.0 generates a partial register stall for
947 __cbtmp^31, due to using "xorb $31" instead of "xorl $31", the former
948 being 1 code byte smaller. "31-__cbtmp" is a workaround, probably at the
949 cost of one extra instruction. Do this for "i386" too, since that means
950 generic x86. */
951#if ! defined (count_leading_zeros) && __GNUC__ < 3 \
952 && (HAVE_HOST_CPU_i386 \
953 || HAVE_HOST_CPU_i686 \
954 || HAVE_HOST_CPU_pentiumpro \
955 || HAVE_HOST_CPU_pentium2 \
956 || HAVE_HOST_CPU_pentium3)
957#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
958 do { \
959 USItype __cbtmp; \
960 ASSERT ((x) != 0); \
961 __asm__ ("bsrl %1,%0" : "=r" (__cbtmp) : "rm" ((USItype)(x))); \
962 (count) = 31 - __cbtmp; \
963 } while (0)
964#endif /* gcc<3 asm bsrl */
965
966#ifndef count_leading_zeros
967#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
968 do { \
969 USItype __cbtmp; \
970 ASSERT ((x) != 0); \
971 __asm__ ("bsrl %1,%0" : "=r" (__cbtmp) : "rm" ((USItype)(x))); \
972 (count) = __cbtmp ^ 31; \
973 } while (0)
974#endif /* asm bsrl */
975
976#if __GMP_GNUC_PREREQ (3,4) /* using bsfl */
977#define count_trailing_zeros(count,x) count_trailing_zeros_gcc_ctz(count,x)
978#endif /* gcc ctz */
979
980#ifndef count_trailing_zeros
981#define count_trailing_zeros(count, x) \
982 do { \
983 ASSERT ((x) != 0); \
984 __asm__ ("bsfl %1,%k0" : "=r" (count) : "rm" ((USItype)(x))); \
985 } while (0)
986#endif /* asm bsfl */
987
988#endif /* ! pentium */
989
990#ifndef UMUL_TIME
991#define UMUL_TIME 10
992#endif
993#ifndef UDIV_TIME
994#define UDIV_TIME 40
995#endif
996#endif /* 80x86 */
997
998#if defined (__amd64__) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 64
999#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1000 __asm__ ("addq %5,%q1\n\tadcq %3,%q0" \
1001 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1002 : "0" ((UDItype)(ah)), "rme" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
1003 "%1" ((UDItype)(al)), "rme" ((UDItype)(bl)))
1004#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1005 __asm__ ("subq %5,%q1\n\tsbbq %3,%q0" \
1006 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1007 : "0" ((UDItype)(ah)), "rme" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
1008 "1" ((UDItype)(al)), "rme" ((UDItype)(bl)))
1009#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
1010 __asm__ ("mulq %3" \
1011 : "=a" (w0), "=d" (w1) \
1012 : "%0" ((UDItype)(u)), "rm" ((UDItype)(v)))
1013#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, dx) /* d renamed to dx avoiding "=d" */\
1014 __asm__ ("divq %4" /* stringification in K&R C */ \
1015 : "=a" (q), "=d" (r) \
1016 : "0" ((UDItype)(n0)), "1" ((UDItype)(n1)), "rm" ((UDItype)(dx)))
1017/* bsrq destination must be a 64-bit register, hence UDItype for __cbtmp. */
1018#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
1019 do { \
1020 UDItype __cbtmp; \
1021 ASSERT ((x) != 0); \
1022 __asm__ ("bsrq %1,%0" : "=r" (__cbtmp) : "rm" ((UDItype)(x))); \
1023 (count) = __cbtmp ^ 63; \
1024 } while (0)
1025/* bsfq destination must be a 64-bit register, "%q0" forces this in case
1026 count is only an int. */
1027#define count_trailing_zeros(count, x) \
1028 do { \
1029 ASSERT ((x) != 0); \
1030 __asm__ ("bsfq %1,%q0" : "=r" (count) : "rm" ((UDItype)(x))); \
1031 } while (0)
1032#endif /* __amd64__ */
1033
1034#if defined (__i860__) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
1035#define rshift_rhlc(r,h,l,c) \
1036 __asm__ ("shr %3,r0,r0\;shrd %1,%2,%0" \
1037 "=r" (r) : "r" (h), "r" (l), "rn" (c))
1038#endif /* i860 */
1039
1040#if defined (__i960__) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
1041#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1042 __asm__ ("cmpo 1,0\;addc %5,%4,%1\;addc %3,%2,%0" \
1043 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1044 : "dI" (ah), "dI" (bh), "%dI" (al), "dI" (bl))
1045#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1046 __asm__ ("cmpo 0,0\;subc %5,%4,%1\;subc %3,%2,%0" \
1047 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1048 : "dI" (ah), "dI" (bh), "dI" (al), "dI" (bl))
1049#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
1050 ({union {UDItype __ll; \
1051 struct {USItype __l, __h;} __i; \
1052 } __x; \
1053 __asm__ ("emul %2,%1,%0" \
1054 : "=d" (__x.__ll) : "%dI" (u), "dI" (v)); \
1055 (w1) = __x.__i.__h; (w0) = __x.__i.__l;})
1056#define __umulsidi3(u, v) \
1057 ({UDItype __w; \
1058 __asm__ ("emul %2,%1,%0" : "=d" (__w) : "%dI" (u), "dI" (v)); \
1059 __w; })
1060#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, nh, nl, d) \
1061 do { \
1062 union {UDItype __ll; \
1063 struct {USItype __l, __h;} __i; \
1064 } __nn; \
1065 __nn.__i.__h = (nh); __nn.__i.__l = (nl); \
1066 __asm__ ("ediv %d,%n,%0" \
1067 : "=d" (__rq.__ll) : "dI" (__nn.__ll), "dI" (d)); \
1068 (r) = __rq.__i.__l; (q) = __rq.__i.__h; \
1069 } while (0)
1070#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
1071 do { \
1072 USItype __cbtmp; \
1073 __asm__ ("scanbit %1,%0" : "=r" (__cbtmp) : "r" (x)); \
1074 (count) = __cbtmp ^ 31; \
1075 } while (0)
1076#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 (-32) /* sic */
1077#if defined (__i960mx) /* what is the proper symbol to test??? */
1078#define rshift_rhlc(r,h,l,c) \
1079 do { \
1080 union {UDItype __ll; \
1081 struct {USItype __l, __h;} __i; \
1082 } __nn; \
1083 __nn.__i.__h = (h); __nn.__i.__l = (l); \
1084 __asm__ ("shre %2,%1,%0" : "=d" (r) : "dI" (__nn.__ll), "dI" (c)); \
1085 }
1086#endif /* i960mx */
1087#endif /* i960 */

1089#if (defined (__mc68000__) || defined (__mc68020__) || defined(mc68020) \
1090 || defined (__m68k__) || defined (__mc5200__) || defined (__mc5206e__) \
1091 || defined (__mc5307__)) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
1092#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1093 __asm__ ("add%.l %5,%1\n\taddx%.l %3,%0" \
1094 : "=d" (sh), "=&d" (sl) \
1095 : "0" ((USItype)(ah)), "d" ((USItype)(bh)), \
1096 "%1" ((USItype)(al)), "g" ((USItype)(bl)))
1097#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1098 __asm__ ("sub%.l %5,%1\n\tsubx%.l %3,%0" \
1099 : "=d" (sh), "=&d" (sl) \
1100 : "0" ((USItype)(ah)), "d" ((USItype)(bh)), \
1101 "1" ((USItype)(al)), "g" ((USItype)(bl)))
1102/* The '020, '030, '040 and CPU32 have 32x32->64 and 64/32->32q-32r. */
1103#if defined (__mc68020__) || defined(mc68020) \
1104 || defined (__mc68030__) || defined (mc68030) \
1105 || defined (__mc68040__) || defined (mc68040) \
1106 || defined (__mcpu32__) || defined (mcpu32) \
1107 || defined (__NeXT__)
1108#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
1109 __asm__ ("mulu%.l %3,%1:%0" \
1110 : "=d" (w0), "=d" (w1) \
1111 : "%0" ((USItype)(u)), "dmi" ((USItype)(v)))
1112#define UMUL_TIME 45
1113#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
1114 __asm__ ("divu%.l %4,%1:%0" \
1115 : "=d" (q), "=d" (r) \
1116 : "0" ((USItype)(n0)), "1" ((USItype)(n1)), "dmi" ((USItype)(d)))
1117#define UDIV_TIME 90
1118#define sdiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
1119 __asm__ ("divs%.l %4,%1:%0" \
1120 : "=d" (q), "=d" (r) \
1121 : "0" ((USItype)(n0)), "1" ((USItype)(n1)), "dmi" ((USItype)(d)))
1122#else /* for other 68k family members use 16x16->32 multiplication */
1123#define umul_ppmm(xh, xl, a, b) \
1124 do { USItype __umul_tmp1, __umul_tmp2; \
1125 __asm__ ("| Inlined umul_ppmm\n" \
1126" move%.l %5,%3\n" \
1127" move%.l %2,%0\n" \
1128" move%.w %3,%1\n" \
1129" swap %3\n" \
1130" swap %0\n" \
1131" mulu%.w %2,%1\n" \
1132" mulu%.w %3,%0\n" \
1133" mulu%.w %2,%3\n" \
1134" swap %2\n" \
1135" mulu%.w %5,%2\n" \
1136" add%.l %3,%2\n" \
1137" jcc 1f\n" \
1138" add%.l %#0x10000,%0\n" \
1139"1: move%.l %2,%3\n" \
1140" clr%.w %2\n" \
1141" swap %2\n" \
1142" swap %3\n" \
1143" clr%.w %3\n" \
1144" add%.l %3,%1\n" \
1145" addx%.l %2,%0\n" \
1146" | End inlined umul_ppmm" \
1147 : "=&d" (xh), "=&d" (xl), \
1148 "=d" (__umul_tmp1), "=&d" (__umul_tmp2) \
1149 : "%2" ((USItype)(a)), "d" ((USItype)(b))); \
1150 } while (0)
1151#define UMUL_TIME 100
1152#define UDIV_TIME 400
1153#endif /* not mc68020 */
1154/* The '020, '030, '040 and '060 have bitfield insns.
1155 GCC 3.4 defines __mc68020__ when in CPU32 mode, check for __mcpu32__ to
1156 exclude bfffo on that chip (bitfield insns not available). */
1157#if (defined (__mc68020__) || defined (mc68020) \
1158 || defined (__mc68030__) || defined (mc68030) \
1159 || defined (__mc68040__) || defined (mc68040) \
1160 || defined (__mc68060__) || defined (mc68060) \
1161 || defined (__NeXT__)) \
1162 && ! defined (__mcpu32__)
1163#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
1164 __asm__ ("bfffo %1{%b2:%b2},%0" \
1165 : "=d" (count) \
1166 : "od" ((USItype) (x)), "n" (0))
1167#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 32
1168#endif
1169#endif /* mc68000 */

1171#if defined (__m88000__) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
1172#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1173 __asm__ ("addu.co %1,%r4,%r5\n\taddu.ci %0,%r2,%r3" \
1174 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1175 : "rJ" (ah), "rJ" (bh), "%rJ" (al), "rJ" (bl))
1176#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1177 __asm__ ("subu.co %1,%r4,%r5\n\tsubu.ci %0,%r2,%r3" \
1178 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1179 : "rJ" (ah), "rJ" (bh), "rJ" (al), "rJ" (bl))
1180#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
1181 do { \
1182 USItype __cbtmp; \
1183 __asm__ ("ff1 %0,%1" : "=r" (__cbtmp) : "r" (x)); \
1184 (count) = __cbtmp ^ 31; \

1187#if defined (__m88110__)
1188#define umul_ppmm(wh, wl, u, v) \
1189 do { \
1190 union {UDItype __ll; \
1191 struct {USItype __h, __l;} __i; \
1192 } __x; \
1193 __asm__ ("mulu.d %0,%1,%2" : "=r" (__x.__ll) : "r" (u), "r" (v)); \
1194 (wh) = __x.__i.__h; \
1195 (wl) = __x.__i.__l; \
1196 } while (0)
1197#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
1198 ({union {UDItype __ll; \
1199 struct {USItype __h, __l;} __i; \
1200 } __x, __q; \
1201 __x.__i.__h = (n1); __x.__i.__l = (n0); \
1202 __asm__ ("divu.d %0,%1,%2" \
1203 : "=r" (__q.__ll) : "r" (__x.__ll), "r" (d)); \
1204 (r) = (n0) - __q.__l * (d); (q) = __q.__l; })

1213#if defined (__mips) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32

1218 w1 = __ll >> 32; \
1219 w0 = __ll; \

1225#endif

1266#if defined (__ns32000__) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
1267#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
1268 ({union {UDItype __ll; \
1269 struct {USItype __l, __h;} __i; \
1270 } __x; \

1278 : "=g" (__w) \

1280 __w; })
1281#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \

1283 struct {USItype __l, __h;} __i; \
1284 } __x; \
1285 __x.__i.__h = (n1); __x.__i.__l = (n0); \

1298/* In the past we had a block of various #defines tested
1299 _ARCH_PPC - AIX
1300 _ARCH_PWR - AIX
1301 __powerpc__ - gcc
1302 __POWERPC__ - BEOS
1303 __ppc__ - Darwin
1304 PPC - old gcc, GNU/Linux, SysV
1305 The plain PPC test was not good for vxWorks, since PPC is defined on all
1306 CPUs there (eg. m68k too), as a constant one is expected to compare
1307 CPU_FAMILY against.
1308
1309 At any rate, this was pretty unattractive and a bit fragile. The use of
1310 HAVE_HOST_CPU_FAMILY is designed to cut through it all and be sure of
1311 getting the desired effect.
1312
1313 ENHANCE-ME: We should test _IBMR2 here when we add assembly support for
1314 the system vendor compilers. (Is that vendor compilers with inline asm,
1315 or what?) */
1316
1317#if (HAVE_HOST_CPU_FAMILY_power || HAVE_HOST_CPU_FAMILY_powerpc) \
1318 && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
1319#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1320 do { \
1321 if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == 0) \
1322 __asm__ ("add%I4c %1,%3,%4\n\taddze %0,%2" \
1323 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) : "r" (ah), "%r" (al), "rI" (bl)); \
1324 else if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == ~(USItype) 0) \
1325 __asm__ ("add%I4c %1,%3,%4\n\taddme %0,%2" \
1326 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) : "r" (ah), "%r" (al), "rI" (bl)); \
1327 else \
1328 __asm__ ("add%I5c %1,%4,%5\n\tadde %0,%2,%3" \
1329 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1330 : "r" (ah), "r" (bh), "%r" (al), "rI" (bl)); \
1331 } while (0)
1332#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1333 do { \
1334 if (__builtin_constant_p (ah) && (ah) == 0) \
1335 __asm__ ("subf%I3c %1,%4,%3\n\tsubfze %0,%2" \
1336 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) : "r" (bh), "rI" (al), "r" (bl));\
1337 else if (__builtin_constant_p (ah) && (ah) == ~(USItype) 0) \
1338 __asm__ ("subf%I3c %1,%4,%3\n\tsubfme %0,%2" \
1339 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) : "r" (bh), "rI" (al), "r" (bl));\
1340 else if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == 0) \
1341 __asm__ ("subf%I3c %1,%4,%3\n\taddme %0,%2" \
1342 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) : "r" (ah), "rI" (al), "r" (bl));\
1343 else if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == ~(USItype) 0) \
1344 __asm__ ("subf%I3c %1,%4,%3\n\taddze %0,%2" \
1345 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) : "r" (ah), "rI" (al), "r" (bl));\
1346 else \
1347 __asm__ ("subf%I4c %1,%5,%4\n\tsubfe %0,%3,%2" \
1348 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1349 : "r" (ah), "r" (bh), "rI" (al), "r" (bl)); \
1350 } while (0)
1351#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
1352 __asm__ ("cntlzw %0,%1" : "=r" (count) : "r" (x))
1353#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 32
1354#if HAVE_HOST_CPU_FAMILY_powerpc
1355#if __GMP_GNUC_PREREQ (4,4) || defined(__clang__)
1356#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
1357 do { \
1358 UDItype __ll = (UDItype)(u) * (v); \
1359 w1 = __ll >> 32; \
1360 w0 = __ll; \
1361 } while (0)
1362#endif
1363#if !defined (umul_ppmm)
1364#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
1365 do { \
1366 USItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
1367 __asm__ ("mulhwu %0,%1,%2" : "=r" (ph) : "%r" (m0), "r" (m1)); \
1368 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
1369 } while (0)
1370#endif
1371#define UMUL_TIME 15
1372#define smul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
1373 do { \
1374 SItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
1375 __asm__ ("mulhw %0,%1,%2" : "=r" (ph) : "%r" (m0), "r" (m1)); \
1376 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
1377 } while (0)
1378#define SMUL_TIME 14
1379#define UDIV_TIME 120
1380#else
1381#define UMUL_TIME 8
1382#define smul_ppmm(xh, xl, m0, m1) \
1383 __asm__ ("mul %0,%2,%3" : "=r" (xh), "=q" (xl) : "r" (m0), "r" (m1))
1384#define SMUL_TIME 4
1385#define sdiv_qrnnd(q, r, nh, nl, d) \
1386 __asm__ ("div %0,%2,%4" : "=r" (q), "=q" (r) : "r" (nh), "1" (nl), "r" (d))
1387#define UDIV_TIME 100
1388#endif
1389#endif /* 32-bit POWER architecture variants. */

1392 vendor compilers. */
1393#if HAVE_HOST_CPU_FAMILY_powerpc && W_TYPE_SIZE == 64
1394#if !defined (_LONG_LONG_LIMB)
1395/* _LONG_LONG_LIMB is ABI=mode32 where adde operates on 32-bit values. So
1396 use adde etc only when not _LONG_LONG_LIMB. */
1397#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1398 do { \
1399 if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == 0) \
1400 __asm__ ("add%I4c %1,%3,%4\n\taddze %0,%2" \
1401 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1402 : "r" ((UDItype)(ah)), \
1403 "%r" ((UDItype)(al)), "rI" ((UDItype)(bl))); \
1404 else if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == ~(UDItype) 0) \
1405 __asm__ ("add%I4c %1,%3,%4\n\taddme %0,%2" \
1406 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1407 : "r" ((UDItype)(ah)), \
1408 "%r" ((UDItype)(al)), "rI" ((UDItype)(bl))); \
1409 else \
1410 __asm__ ("add%I5c %1,%4,%5\n\tadde %0,%2,%3" \
1411 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1412 : "r" ((UDItype)(ah)), "r" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
1413 "%r" ((UDItype)(al)), "rI" ((UDItype)(bl))); \
1414 } while (0)
1415/* We use "*rI" for the constant operand here, since with just "I", gcc barfs.
1416 This might seem strange, but gcc folds away the dead code late. */
1417#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1418 do { \
1419 if (__builtin_constant_p (bl) && bl > -0x8000 && bl <= 0x8000) { \
1420 if (__builtin_constant_p (ah) && (ah) == 0) \
1421 __asm__ ("addic %1,%3,%4\n\tsubfze %0,%2" \
1422 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1423 : "r" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
1424 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "*rI" (-((UDItype)(bl)))); \
1425 else if (__builtin_constant_p (ah) && (ah) == ~(UDItype) 0) \
1426 __asm__ ("addic %1,%3,%4\n\tsubfme %0,%2" \
1427 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1428 : "r" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
1429 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "*rI" (-((UDItype)(bl)))); \
1430 else if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == 0) \
1431 __asm__ ("addic %1,%3,%4\n\taddme %0,%2" \
1432 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1433 : "r" ((UDItype)(ah)), \
1434 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "*rI" (-((UDItype)(bl)))); \
1435 else if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == ~(UDItype) 0) \
1436 __asm__ ("addic %1,%3,%4\n\taddze %0,%2" \
1437 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1438 : "r" ((UDItype)(ah)), \
1439 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "*rI" (-((UDItype)(bl)))); \
1440 else \
1441 __asm__ ("addic %1,%4,%5\n\tsubfe %0,%3,%2" \
1442 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1443 : "r" ((UDItype)(ah)), "r" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
1444 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "*rI" (-((UDItype)(bl)))); \
1445 } else { \
1446 if (__builtin_constant_p (ah) && (ah) == 0) \
1447 __asm__ ("subf%I3c %1,%4,%3\n\tsubfze %0,%2" \
1448 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1449 : "r" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
1450 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "r" ((UDItype)(bl))); \
1451 else if (__builtin_constant_p (ah) && (ah) == ~(UDItype) 0) \
1452 __asm__ ("subf%I3c %1,%4,%3\n\tsubfme %0,%2" \
1453 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1454 : "r" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
1455 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "r" ((UDItype)(bl))); \
1456 else if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == 0) \
1457 __asm__ ("subf%I3c %1,%4,%3\n\taddme %0,%2" \
1458 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1459 : "r" ((UDItype)(ah)), \
1460 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "r" ((UDItype)(bl))); \
1461 else if (__builtin_constant_p (bh) && (bh) == ~(UDItype) 0) \
1462 __asm__ ("subf%I3c %1,%4,%3\n\taddze %0,%2" \
1463 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1464 : "r" ((UDItype)(ah)), \
1465 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "r" ((UDItype)(bl))); \
1466 else \
1467 __asm__ ("subf%I4c %1,%5,%4\n\tsubfe %0,%3,%2" \
1468 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1469 : "r" ((UDItype)(ah)), "r" ((UDItype)(bh)), \
1470 "rI" ((UDItype)(al)), "r" ((UDItype)(bl))); \
1471 } \
1472 } while (0)
1473#endif /* ! _LONG_LONG_LIMB */
1474#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
1475 __asm__ ("cntlzd %0,%1" : "=r" (count) : "r" (x))
1476#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 64
1477#if 0 && (__GMP_GNUC_PREREQ (4,4) || defined(__clang__)) /* Disable, this results in libcalls! */
1478#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
1479 do { \
1480 typedef unsigned int __ll_UTItype __attribute__((mode(TI))); \
1481 __ll_UTItype __ll = (__ll_UTItype)(u) * (v); \
1482 w1 = __ll >> 64; \
1483 w0 = __ll; \
1484 } while (0)
1485#endif
1486#if !defined (umul_ppmm)
1487#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
1488 do { \
1489 UDItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
1490 __asm__ ("mulhdu %0,%1,%2" : "=r" (ph) : "%r" (__m0), "r" (__m1)); \
1491 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
1492 } while (0)
1493#endif
1494#define UMUL_TIME 15
1495#define smul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
1496 do { \
1497 DItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
1498 __asm__ ("mulhd %0,%1,%2" : "=r" (ph) : "%r" (__m0), "r" (__m1)); \
1499 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
1500 } while (0)

1506#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \

1508 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1509 : "0" ((USItype)(ah)), "g" ((USItype)(bh)), \

1513 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1514 : "0" ((USItype)(ah)), "g" ((USItype)(bh)), \
1515 "1" ((USItype)(al)), "g" ((USItype)(bl)))
1516/* This insn works on Pyramids with AP, XP, or MI CPUs, but not with SP. */
1517#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
1518 ({union {UDItype __ll; \
1519 struct {USItype __h, __l;} __i; \
1520 } __x; \
1521 __asm__ ("movw %1,%R0\n\tuemul %2,%0" \
1522 : "=&r" (__x.__ll) \

1524 (w1) = __x.__i.__h; (w0) = __x.__i.__l;})

1538#define smul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \

1565#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
1566 do { \
1567 if ((x) >= 0x10000) \
1568 __asm__ ("clz %0,%1" \
1569 : "=r" (count) : "r" ((USItype)(x) >> 16)); \
1570 else \
1571 { \
1572 __asm__ ("clz %0,%1" \
1573 : "=r" (count) : "r" ((USItype)(x))); \
1574 (count) += 16; \
1575 } \
1576 } while (0)
1577#endif /* RT/ROMP */

1613#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
1614 do { \
1615 USItype __q; \
1616 __asm__ ("mov %1,%%y;nop;nop;nop;udiv %2,%3,%0" \
1617 : "=r" (__q) : "r" (n1), "r" (n0), "r" (d)); \
1618 (r) = (n0) - __q * (d); \
1619 (q) = __q; \
1620 } while (0)
1621#else
1622#if defined (__sparc_v8__) /* gcc normal */ \
1623 || defined (__sparcv8) /* gcc solaris */ \
1624 || HAVE_HOST_CPU_supersparc
1625/* Don't match immediate range because, 1) it is not often useful,
1626 2) the 'I' flag thinks of the range as a 13 bit signed interval,
1627 while we want to match a 13 bit interval, sign extended to 32 bits,
1628 but INTERPRETED AS UNSIGNED. */
1629#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
1630 __asm__ ("umul %2,%3,%1;rd %%y,%0" : "=r" (w1), "=r" (w0) : "r" (u), "r" (v))
1631#define UMUL_TIME 5

1634#define UDIV_TIME 60 /* SuperSPARC timing */
1635#else

1637 dividends and will trap to the kernel for the rest. */
1638#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
1639 do { \
1640 USItype __q; \
1641 __asm__ ("mov %1,%%y;nop;nop;nop;udiv %2,%3,%0" \
1642 : "=r" (__q) : "r" (n1), "r" (n0), "r" (d)); \
1643 (r) = (n0) - __q * (d); \
1644 (q) = __q; \
1645 } while (0)
1646#define UDIV_TIME 25
1647#endif /* HAVE_HOST_CPU_supersparc */

1799#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
1800 do { \
1801 UDItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
1802 (pl) = __m0 * __m1; \
1803 __asm__ ("umulxhi\t%2, %1, %0" \
1804 : "=r" (ph) \
1805 : "%r" (__m0), "r" (__m1)); \
1806 } while (0)
1807#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
1808 __asm__ ("lzd\t%1,%0" : "=r" (count) : "r" (x))
1809/* Needed by count_leading_zeros_32 in sparc64.h. */
1810#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_NEED_CLZ_TAB
1811#endif
1812#endif
1813
1814#if (defined (__vax) || defined (__vax__)) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 32
1815#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1816 __asm__ ("addl2 %5,%1\n\tadwc %3,%0" \
1817 : "=g" (sh), "=&g" (sl) \
1818 : "0" ((USItype)(ah)), "g" ((USItype)(bh)), \
1819 "%1" ((USItype)(al)), "g" ((USItype)(bl)))
1820#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1821 __asm__ ("subl2 %5,%1\n\tsbwc %3,%0" \
1822 : "=g" (sh), "=&g" (sl) \
1823 : "0" ((USItype)(ah)), "g" ((USItype)(bh)), \
1824 "1" ((USItype)(al)), "g" ((USItype)(bl)))
1825#define smul_ppmm(xh, xl, m0, m1) \
1826 do { \
1827 union {UDItype __ll; \
1828 struct {USItype __l, __h;} __i; \
1829 } __x; \
1830 USItype __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
1831 __asm__ ("emul %1,%2,$0,%0" \
1832 : "=g" (__x.__ll) : "g" (__m0), "g" (__m1)); \
1833 (xh) = __x.__i.__h; (xl) = __x.__i.__l; \
1834 } while (0)
1835#define sdiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
1836 do { \
1837 union {DItype __ll; \
1838 struct {SItype __l, __h;} __i; \
1839 } __x; \
1840 __x.__i.__h = n1; __x.__i.__l = n0; \
1841 __asm__ ("ediv %3,%2,%0,%1" \
1842 : "=g" (q), "=g" (r) : "g" (__x.__ll), "g" (d)); \
1843 } while (0)
1844#if 0
1845/* FIXME: This instruction appears to be unimplemented on some systems (vax
1846 8800 maybe). */
1847#define count_trailing_zeros(count,x) \
1848 do { \
1849 __asm__ ("ffs 0, 31, %1, %0" \
1850 : "=g" (count) \
1851 : "g" ((USItype) (x))); \
1852 } while (0)
1853#endif
1854#endif /* vax */
1855
1856#if defined (__z8000__) && W_TYPE_SIZE == 16
1857#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1858 __asm__ ("add %H1,%H5\n\tadc %H0,%H3" \
1859 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1860 : "0" ((unsigned int)(ah)), "r" ((unsigned int)(bh)), \
1861 "%1" ((unsigned int)(al)), "rQR" ((unsigned int)(bl)))
1862#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1863 __asm__ ("sub %H1,%H5\n\tsbc %H0,%H3" \
1864 : "=r" (sh), "=&r" (sl) \
1865 : "0" ((unsigned int)(ah)), "r" ((unsigned int)(bh)), \
1866 "1" ((unsigned int)(al)), "rQR" ((unsigned int)(bl)))
1867#define umul_ppmm(xh, xl, m0, m1) \
1868 do { \
1869 union {long int __ll; \
1870 struct {unsigned int __h, __l;} __i; \
1871 } __x; \
1872 unsigned int __m0 = (m0), __m1 = (m1); \
1873 __asm__ ("mult %S0,%H3" \
1874 : "=r" (__x.__i.__h), "=r" (__x.__i.__l) \
1875 : "%1" (m0), "rQR" (m1)); \
1876 (xh) = __x.__i.__h; (xl) = __x.__i.__l; \
1877 (xh) += ((((signed int) __m0 >> 15) & __m1) \
1878 + (((signed int) __m1 >> 15) & __m0)); \
1879 } while (0)
1880#endif /* __z8000__ */
1881
1882#endif /* __GNUC__ */
1883
1884#endif /* NO_ASM */
1885

1887/* FIXME: "sidi" here is highly doubtful, should sometimes be "diti". */
1888#if !defined (umul_ppmm) && defined (__umulsidi3)
1889#define umul_ppmm(ph, pl, m0, m1) \
1890 do { \
1891 UDWtype __ll = __umulsidi3 (m0, m1); \
1892 ph = (UWtype) (__ll >> W_TYPE_SIZE); \
1893 pl = (UWtype) __ll; \
1894 } while (0)
1895#endif
1896
1897#if !defined (__umulsidi3)
1898#define __umulsidi3(u, v) \
1899 ({UWtype __hi, __lo; \
1900 umul_ppmm (__hi, __lo, u, v); \
1901 ((UDWtype) __hi << W_TYPE_SIZE) | __lo; })
1902#endif

1911/* Use mpn_umul_ppmm or mpn_udiv_qrnnd functions, if they exist. The "_r"
1912 forms have "reversed" arguments, meaning the pointer is last, which
1913 sometimes allows better parameter passing, in particular on 64-bit
1914 hppa. */
1915
1916#define mpn_umul_ppmm __MPN(umul_ppmm)
1917extern __longlong_h_C UWtype mpn_umul_ppmm (UWtype *, UWtype, UWtype);
1918
1919#if ! defined (umul_ppmm) && HAVE_NATIVE_mpn_umul_ppmm \
1920 && ! defined (LONGLONG_STANDALONE)
1921#define umul_ppmm(wh, wl, u, v) \
1922 do { \
1923 UWtype __umul_ppmm__p0; \
1924 (wh) = mpn_umul_ppmm (&__umul_ppmm__p0, (UWtype) (u), (UWtype) (v));\
1925 (wl) = __umul_ppmm__p0; \
1926 } while (0)
1927#endif
1928
1929#define mpn_umul_ppmm_r __MPN(umul_ppmm_r)
1930extern __longlong_h_C UWtype mpn_umul_ppmm_r (UWtype, UWtype, UWtype *);
1931
1932#if ! defined (umul_ppmm) && HAVE_NATIVE_mpn_umul_ppmm_r \
1933 && ! defined (LONGLONG_STANDALONE)
1934#define umul_ppmm(wh, wl, u, v) \
1935 do { \
1936 UWtype __umul_p0; \
1937 (wh) = mpn_umul_ppmm_r ((UWtype) (u), (UWtype) (v), &__umul_p0); \
1938 (wl) = __umul_p0; \
1939 } while (0)
1940#endif
1941
1942#define mpn_udiv_qrnnd __MPN(udiv_qrnnd)
1943extern __longlong_h_C UWtype mpn_udiv_qrnnd (UWtype *, UWtype, UWtype, UWtype);
1944
1945#if ! defined (udiv_qrnnd) && HAVE_NATIVE_mpn_udiv_qrnnd \
1946 && ! defined (LONGLONG_STANDALONE)
1947#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
1948 do { \
1949 UWtype __udiv_qrnnd_r; \
1950 (q) = mpn_udiv_qrnnd (&__udiv_qrnnd_r, \
1951 (UWtype) (n1), (UWtype) (n0), (UWtype) d); \
1952 (r) = __udiv_qrnnd_r; \
1953 } while (0)
1954#endif
1955
1956#define mpn_udiv_qrnnd_r __MPN(udiv_qrnnd_r)
1957extern __longlong_h_C UWtype mpn_udiv_qrnnd_r (UWtype, UWtype, UWtype, UWtype *);
1958
1959#if ! defined (udiv_qrnnd) && HAVE_NATIVE_mpn_udiv_qrnnd_r \
1960 && ! defined (LONGLONG_STANDALONE)
1961#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
1962 do { \
1963 UWtype __udiv_qrnnd_r; \
1964 (q) = mpn_udiv_qrnnd_r ((UWtype) (n1), (UWtype) (n0), (UWtype) d, \
1965 &__udiv_qrnnd_r); \
1966 (r) = __udiv_qrnnd_r; \
1967 } while (0)
1968#endif

1971/* If this machine has no inline assembler, use C macros. */
1972
1973#if !defined (add_ssaaaa)
1974#define add_ssaaaa(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1975 do { \
1976 UWtype __x; \
1977 __x = (al) + (bl); \
1978 (sh) = (ah) + (bh) + (__x < (al)); \
1979 (sl) = __x; \
1980 } while (0)
1981#endif
1982
1983#if !defined (sub_ddmmss)
1984#define sub_ddmmss(sh, sl, ah, al, bh, bl) \
1985 do { \
1986 UWtype __x; \
1987 __x = (al) - (bl); \
1988 (sh) = (ah) - (bh) - ((al) < (bl)); \
1989 (sl) = __x; \
1990 } while (0)
1991#endif
1992
1993/* If we lack umul_ppmm but have smul_ppmm, define umul_ppmm in terms of
1994 smul_ppmm. */
1995#if !defined (umul_ppmm) && defined (smul_ppmm)
1996#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
1997 do { \
1998 UWtype __w1; \
1999 UWtype __xm0 = (u), __xm1 = (v); \
2000 smul_ppmm (__w1, w0, __xm0, __xm1); \
2001 (w1) = __w1 + (-(__xm0 >> (W_TYPE_SIZE - 1)) & __xm1) \
2002 + (-(__xm1 >> (W_TYPE_SIZE - 1)) & __xm0); \
2003 } while (0)
2004#endif
2005
2006/* If we still don't have umul_ppmm, define it using plain C.
2007
2008 For reference, when this code is used for squaring (ie. u and v identical
2009 expressions), gcc recognises __x1 and __x2 are the same and generates 3
2010 multiplies, not 4. The subsequent additions could be optimized a bit,
2011 but the only place GMP currently uses such a square is mpn_sqr_basecase,
2012 and chips obliged to use this generic C umul will have plenty of worse
2013 performance problems than a couple of extra instructions on the diagonal
2014 of sqr_basecase. */
2015
2016#if !defined (umul_ppmm)
2017#define umul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
2018 do { \
2019 UWtype __x0, __x1, __x2, __x3; \
2020 UHWtype __ul, __vl, __uh, __vh; \
2021 UWtype __u = (u), __v = (v); \
2022 \
2023 __ul = __ll_lowpart (__u); \
2024 __uh = __ll_highpart (__u); \
2025 __vl = __ll_lowpart (__v); \
2026 __vh = __ll_highpart (__v); \
2027 \
2028 __x0 = (UWtype) __ul * __vl; \
2029 __x1 = (UWtype) __ul * __vh; \
2030 __x2 = (UWtype) __uh * __vl; \
2031 __x3 = (UWtype) __uh * __vh; \
2032 \
2033 __x1 += __ll_highpart (__x0);/* this can't give carry */ \
2034 __x1 += __x2; /* but this indeed can */ \
2035 if (__x1 < __x2) /* did we get it? */ \
2036 __x3 += __ll_B; /* yes, add it in the proper pos. */ \
2037 \
2038 (w1) = __x3 + __ll_highpart (__x1); \
2039 (w0) = (__x1 << W_TYPE_SIZE/2) + __ll_lowpart (__x0); \
2040 } while (0)
2041#endif
2042
2043/* If we don't have smul_ppmm, define it using umul_ppmm (which surely will
2044 exist in one form or another. */
2045#if !defined (smul_ppmm)
2046#define smul_ppmm(w1, w0, u, v) \
2047 do { \
2048 UWtype __w1; \
2049 UWtype __xm0 = (u), __xm1 = (v); \
2050 umul_ppmm (__w1, w0, __xm0, __xm1); \
2051 (w1) = __w1 - (-(__xm0 >> (W_TYPE_SIZE - 1)) & __xm1) \
2052 - (-(__xm1 >> (W_TYPE_SIZE - 1)) & __xm0); \
2053 } while (0)
2054#endif
2055
2056/* Define this unconditionally, so it can be used for debugging. */
2057#define __udiv_qrnnd_c(q, r, n1, n0, d) \
2058 do { \
2059 UWtype __d1, __d0, __q1, __q0, __r1, __r0, __m; \
2060 \
2061 ASSERT ((d) != 0); \
2062 ASSERT ((n1) < (d)); \
2063 \
2064 __d1 = __ll_highpart (d); \
2065 __d0 = __ll_lowpart (d); \
2066 \
2067 __q1 = (n1) / __d1; \
2068 __r1 = (n1) - __q1 * __d1; \
2069 __m = __q1 * __d0; \
2070 __r1 = __r1 * __ll_B | __ll_highpart (n0); \
2071 if (__r1 < __m) \
2072 { \
2073 __q1--, __r1 += (d); \
2074 if (__r1 >= (d)) /* i.e. we didn't get carry when adding to __r1 */\
2075 if (__r1 < __m) \
2076 __q1--, __r1 += (d); \
2077 } \
2078 __r1 -= __m; \
2079 \
2080 __q0 = __r1 / __d1; \
2081 __r0 = __r1 - __q0 * __d1; \
2082 __m = __q0 * __d0; \
2083 __r0 = __r0 * __ll_B | __ll_lowpart (n0); \
2084 if (__r0 < __m) \
2085 { \
2086 __q0--, __r0 += (d); \
2087 if (__r0 >= (d)) \
2088 if (__r0 < __m) \
2089 __q0--, __r0 += (d); \
2090 } \
2091 __r0 -= __m; \
2092 \
2093 (q) = __q1 * __ll_B | __q0; \
2094 (r) = __r0; \
2095 } while (0)
2096
2097/* If the processor has no udiv_qrnnd but sdiv_qrnnd, go through
2098 __udiv_w_sdiv (defined in libgcc or elsewhere). */
2099#if !defined (udiv_qrnnd) && defined (sdiv_qrnnd) && !defined(LONGLONG_STANDALONE)
2100#define udiv_qrnnd(q, r, nh, nl, d) \
2101 do { \
2102 UWtype __r; \
2103 (q) = __MPN(udiv_w_sdiv) (&__r, nh, nl, d); \
2104 (r) = __r; \
2105 } while (0)
2106__GMP_DECLSPEC UWtype __MPN(udiv_w_sdiv) (UWtype *, UWtype, UWtype, UWtype);
2107#endif
2108
2109/* If udiv_qrnnd was not defined for this processor, use __udiv_qrnnd_c. */
2110#if !defined (udiv_qrnnd)
2111#define UDIV_NEEDS_NORMALIZATION 1
2112#define udiv_qrnnd __udiv_qrnnd_c
2113#endif
2114
2115#if !defined (count_leading_zeros)
2116#define count_leading_zeros(count, x) \
2117 do { \
2118 UWtype __xr = (x); \
2119 UWtype __a; \
2120 \
2121 if (W_TYPE_SIZE == 32) \
2122 { \
2123 __a = __xr < ((UWtype) 1 << 2*__BITS4) \
2124 ? (__xr < ((UWtype) 1 << __BITS4) ? 1 : __BITS4 + 1) \
2125 : (__xr < ((UWtype) 1 << 3*__BITS4) ? 2*__BITS4 + 1 \
2126 : 3*__BITS4 + 1); \
2127 } \
2128 else \
2129 { \
2130 for (__a = W_TYPE_SIZE - 8; __a > 0; __a -= 8) \
2131 if (((__xr >> __a) & 0xff) != 0) \
2132 break; \
2133 ++__a; \
2134 } \
2135 \
2136 (count) = W_TYPE_SIZE + 1 - __a - __clz_tab[__xr >> __a]; \
2137 } while (0)
2138/* This version gives a well-defined value for zero. */
2139#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_0 (W_TYPE_SIZE - 1)
2140#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_NEED_CLZ_TAB
2141#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_SLOW
2142#endif
2143
2144/* clz_tab needed by mpn/x86/pentium/mod_1.asm in a fat binary */
2145#if HAVE_HOST_CPU_FAMILY_x86 && WANT_FAT_BINARY
2146#define COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_NEED_CLZ_TAB
2147#endif
2148
2149#ifdef COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_NEED_CLZ_TAB
2150extern const unsigned char __GMP_DECLSPEC __clz_tab[129];
2151#endif
2152
2153#if !defined (count_trailing_zeros)
2154#if !defined (COUNT_LEADING_ZEROS_SLOW)
2155/* Define count_trailing_zeros using an asm count_leading_zeros. */
2156#define count_trailing_zeros(count, x) \
2157 do { \
2158 UWtype __ctz_x = (x); \
2159 UWtype __ctz_c; \
2160 ASSERT (__ctz_x != 0); \
2161 count_leading_zeros (__ctz_c, __ctz_x & -__ctz_x); \
2162 (count) = W_TYPE_SIZE - 1 - __ctz_c; \
2163 } while (0)
2164#else
2165/* Define count_trailing_zeros in plain C, assuming small counts are common.
2166 We use clz_tab without ado, since the C count_leading_zeros above will have
2167 pulled it in. */
2168#define count_trailing_zeros(count, x) \
2169 do { \
2170 UWtype __ctz_x = (x); \
2171 int __ctz_c; \
2172 \
2173 if (LIKELY ((__ctz_x & 0xff) != 0)) \
2174 (count) = __clz_tab[__ctz_x & -__ctz_x] - 2; \
2175 else \
2176 { \
2177 for (__ctz_c = 8 - 2; __ctz_c < W_TYPE_SIZE - 2; __ctz_c += 8) \
2178 { \
2179 __ctz_x >>= 8; \
2180 if (LIKELY ((__ctz_x & 0xff) != 0)) \
2181 break; \
2182 } \
2183 \
2184 (count) = __ctz_c + __clz_tab[__ctz_x & -__ctz_x]; \
2185 } \
2186 } while (0)
2187#endif
2188#endif
2189
2190#ifndef UDIV_NEEDS_NORMALIZATION
2191#define UDIV_NEEDS_NORMALIZATION 0
2192#endif

2195 that hence the latter should always be used. */
2196#ifndef UDIV_PREINV_ALWAYS
2197#define UDIV_PREINV_ALWAYS 0
2198#endif
